tool_description: This API provides endpoints to retrieve chatbot responses from a database. It allows users to fetch responses by ID, status, or retrieve all responses.
name: ChatBot Sentence API
title: ChatBot Sentence API

api_list.name: Get Specified Status (Random)
api_list.description:
You can get only 1 sentence from specified status randomly. 
Random query must be **true** for random sentence.

Valid Status:
**starting,common,ending**

Adding random query:
/api/sentence/status/:value?**random=true**

api_list.name: Get Specified Status (All)
api_list.description:
You can get specified status relaated **ALL** sentences on API.

Valid Values: 
**starting,common,ending**
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://chatbot-sentence-api.p.rapidapi.com/api/sentence/status/starting"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "chatbot-sentence-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://chatbot-sentence-api.p.rapidapi.com/api/sentence/status/{value}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "chatbot-sentence-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Get Specified Id
api_list.description:
You can get specified id on API. 

Usage :
**/api/sentence/id/:*{value}***
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://chatbot-sentence-api.p.rapidapi.com/api/sentence/id/10"

headers = {

print(response.json())

api_list.name: Get Main Help
api_list.description:
**/sentence, /sentence/id, /sentence/status**

These endpoints provide users with essential information about the available routes and how to use them effectively. The help pages offer guidance on using specific endpoints, while getting all routes helps users discover the entire API surface.

api_list.name: Get Server Status
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to check the status of the server hosting the API and obtain operational is *true* or *false*. By sending a **GET** request to the root endpoint **/api**, you can retrieve in formation regarding the current status of the server.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://chatbot-sentence-api.p.rapidapi.com/api"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "chatbot-sentence-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
